page.title: 02MOORENDS
page.content: nicknamed The Bullring, but shoppers regularly go to Thorne or Doncaster to shop because the bus fares are cheap. On the outskirts of the village, near Thorne, is the Coulman industrial estate where there are small units leased out to firms for factories. The farms in the D block are arable, growing wheat,barley,oilseed rape and peas. {MOORENDS OLD AND NEW. { }Over the years, Moorends has changed considerably. There was no electricity until 1930, so before that,paraffin lamps were used. Also, if you wanted to go out at night, you carried a candle in a jam jar. Now the streets are well lit with electric street lights. The first school for the children was simply a hut or two and children of all ages were taught there.
